Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2009 04:29AM aly wrote: Hi,  I just wanted to say I was also tested and came back neg but I remember my doctor saying that a patient was tested and came back neg then tested again after ten years and was positive. This was because the tests had improved.  I take my result as being negative at this moment in time awaiting further research. My family were also all in their early 40's Best wishes...

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2009 10:31AM aly wrote: Thanks for replying, I was reading research and now they are researching into subgroups of ER+ etc. I read that ER+ and PR- means that there was more possibility for a negative reaction for tamox because you can build up a resistance. Don't want to worry anyone! Its about 50% from statistics. Maybe an answer to why cancer is a sod? Diana 50 your reply is quite correct  but I am always curious! Bugs thanks for the wave. you seem to be the oldest here! rock on. Jane if you wish to pm me for info feel free.
